geninfo.para: TSI-03-08-02 contained the operating instructions for the new RKE systems installed in the 9000i Model Series built after January 31, 2003. With the introduction of the new system, it was discovered that some vehicles exhibit a slight glow in the Parking Brake Indicator Lamp when the parking brake is not applied. The glow may not be noticed during daylight but can be seen when the cab is dark. This glow does not affect the operation of the vehicle parking braking system or RKE. If a customer complains of the glow in the Parking Brake Indicator Lamp and the vehicle meets the above parameters, performing the following procedure will eliminate the Parking Brake Indicator Lamp glow.

partsinfo.para: 220 Ohm 1 watt resistor, obtain locally. Resistor should have two red and one black colored band near one end.
2" Section of ¼" Heat Shrink Tubing

warning.para: Failure to disconnect the negative battery terminal before performing work on the vehicle electrical system could cause an electrical short and could result in property damage, personal injury, or death.

Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to avoid property damage, personal injury or death.

step1.para: Disconnect the negative battery terminal at the battery.
Remove the driver side kick panel under the dash to allow access to the under side of the vehicle ignition switch.
Remove connector from the ignition switch "G" terminal. The connector should contain both circuits 81X (18GY) and 44 (16GY) as shown in Figure 1.
Remove the connector and terminal from the end of the two circuits.
Shorten 81X approximately 1 1/2" and strip the wire end to allow for solder connection.
Install one two-inch piece of ¼" heat shrink tubing over the ends of both wires.

Solder 220 Ohm-1 watt resistor to the end of the striped circuit 81X wire. Shorten both ends of the resistor so its total length is approximately the same length as the length removed from circuit 81X in 4. above.
Join the other end of the resistor and circuit 44 together and crimp a new terminal (1660577C1) on the resistor and wire.
Slide the shrink wrap tubing over the solder joint, resistor, and the terminal end.
Apply heat to tubing and shrink it snugly around the resistor and wire.
Lock the terminal back into the connector and reinstall connector on terminal "G" at the ignition switch.
Reconnect the negative terminal on the battery and verify that the Parking Brake Warning Lamp is no longer illuminated when the Parking Brake is off and that the RKE works properly.
Reinstall the driver's side kick panel.
